item.title: Sakina add a quote by Angela Carter
item.description: "Moonlight, white satin, roses. A bride." -- Angela Carter

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "The person who deserves most pity is a lonesome one on a rainy day who doesn't know how to read." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Sakina add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "To the uneducated an A is just three sticks." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Peter S. Jennison
item.description: "Children deprived of words become school dropouts; dropouts deprived of hope behave delinquently. Amateur censors blame delinquency on reading immoral books and magazines, when in fact, the inability to read anything is the basic trouble." -- Peter S. Jennison

item.title: Sakina add a quote by St. Thomas Aquinas
item.description: "Beware the man of a single book." -- St. Thomas Aquinas

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "The worst illiterate is the political illiterate, he doesn’t hear, doesn’t speak, nor participates in the political events. He doesn’t know the cost of life, the price of the bean, of the fish, of the flour, of the rent, of the shoes and of the medicine, all depends on political decisions. The political illiterate is so stupid that he is proud and swells his chest saying that he hates politics. The imbecile doesn’t know that, from his political ignorance is born the prostitute, the abandoned child, and the worst thieves of all, the bad politician, corrupted and flunky of the national and multinational companies." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Nicole Peeler
item.description: "I blinked at her, suddenly loathing her to the depths of my soul. Not only was she probably rather evil, and definitely thoroughly unpleasant, but she also didn't read." -- Nicole Peeler

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Alberto Manguel
item.description: "As centuries of dictators have known, an illiterate crowd is the easiest to rule; since the craft of reading cannot be untaught once it has been acquired, the second-best recourse is to limit its scope." -- Alberto Manguel

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Toba Beta
item.description: "Ignorance is a knowledge illiteracy." -- Toba Beta

item.title: Sakina add a quote by Eve Ensler
item.description: "I want to read so I can read the Koran read the signs in the street know the number of the bus I'm supposed to take when I one day leave this house." -- Eve Ensler
